title: Error "expected identifier, found reserved identifier" is slightly weird

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```rust
struct S { _: u32 }
```

or

```rust
enum E { _ }
```

or

```rust
enum T<_> {}
```

or

```rust
trait Foo<const _: u32> {}
```

### Current output

```
error: expected identifier, found reserved identifier `_`
```

### Why this might be a problem

Reading this made me wonder: "Is a reserved identifier a type of identifier?"

idk, maybe it's fine

### Suggested improvement

These could each have unique messages such as:

* "the placeholder `_` is not allowed as the name of a struct field"
* "the placeholder `_` is not allowed as the name of an enum variant"
* "the placeholder `_` is not allowed as the name of a generic parameter"

This has precedent in the error given for `fn f(x: _) {}`:

* "the placeholder `_` is not allowed within types on item signatures for functions"
